Had dinner here during our first night in Barcelona after we stumbled upon it strolling through L'Eixample.  My wife had a huge bowl of cream of artichoke soup and I had a tomato, Spanish onion and tuna belly salad to start.  My salad was full of flavor and I had to fight her off with my utensils to keep her from stealing it all.  For the main course I had pork in red curry and coconut milk.  The pork was a bit dry but there was so much flavor from the curry and coconut milk that I almost didn't notice.  She had chicken brochettes over rice which was also very flavorful.  We had a great bottle of red that was a blend and at13€ was the highest priced red on the menu.  The meal was only 48€.  If I lived in Barcelona, I'd be a regular.
